</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2oa

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.55

</value></part><part><name>gr1 </name>=<value> Multiplayer

</value></part><part><name>gr2 </name>=<value> Event Handlers

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Adds MP event handler (EH) to the given object and returns EH handle.<br>
MP event handlers are added globally to every client on network in multiplayer and will fire on every client too upon event.
If EH has some data to return upon event (e.g. the "MPKilled" EH will return an array with 2 elements: the killed unit, and the killer), it is passed in <tt>_this</tt> variable.<br>
<br>
Since Arma 3 v.1.63.137807 the EH handle is also stored in <tt>_thisEventHandler</tt> variable and is available during EH code execution.<br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Informative </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> For more information, see [[Arma_3:_Event_Handlers#Multiplayer_Event_Handlers|Event Handlers/addMPEventHandler]].</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> object [[addMPEventHandler]] [type, expression]

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]] - object to monitor

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> type: [[String]] - event handler name

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> expression: [[String]] or [[Code]] - expression to execute

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Number]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_index = player [[addMPEventHandler]] ["MPKilled", { [[Magic Variables#this|_this]] [[execVM]] "playerKilled.sqf"; }]; </code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[:Category:Event Handlers|EventHandlers list]], [[removeMPEventHandler]], [[removeAllMPEventHandlers]]
</value></part></template>
